title: Is a shrine a monument? - Quora

response.answer_text: What's the difference between memorial and shrine MEMORIAL 1 - A structure, such as a monument, intended to celebrate the memory of a person or event 2 - A service of remembrance or commemoration 3 - (legal) a statement of facts set out in the form of a petition to a person in authority, a court or tribunal, a government, etc . SHRINE 1 - A holy or sacred place dedicated to a specific deity, ancestor, hero, martyr, saint, or similar figure of awe and respect, at which said figure is venerated or worshipped. 2 - A case, box, or receptacle, especially one in which are deposited sacred relics, as the bones of a saint. 3 - A place or object hallowed from its history or associations. a shrine of art
